faqs.title: FAQS
faqs.subtitle: The world of driving can be a very confusing place. So, to help out, we have compiled a list of the most frequently asked questions for you to have a browse through.

faqs.question: How do I get a CBT Licence?
answer: You must be at least 16 year of age (to ride a 50cc moped) or 17 years or above to ride up to 125cc).
You must have either a UK Provisional, UK Full, or EU Driving Licence (with supporting D91 Form).
Be able to demonstrate basic balance and co-ordination (usually, but not always, this is means being able to ride a bicycle to a competent standard).
Make sure you have read, and understand the Highway Code, and UK road traffic procedure.
Choose a date and book a CBT course online, or over the phone by calling our offices on 020 8597 7333 or 0800 848 8418.

faqs.question: Can I fail my CBT Test?
answer: Technically, you cannot 'fail' a CBT as it is not a test but a training course. However, if you do not demonstrate the required competency levels, you will not receive your CBT certificate on the day.
In such cases, additional training may be required before you can complete your CBT successfully.

faqs.question: I cannot speak English very well, can I still do a CBT?
answer: Yes, you can still complete a CBT even if your English is limited. However, you must be able to understand basic safety instructions and road signs.
Our instructors are experienced in working with students who have varying levels of English proficiency.

faqs.question: What is the biggest bike I can ride with a CBT?
answer: With a CBT certificate, you can ride motorcycles up to 125cc with a maximum power output of 11kW (14.6bhp).
You must display L-plates and cannot carry passengers or ride on motorways.

faqs.question: Do I get my CBT Certificate on the same day?
answer: Yes, if you successfully complete all elements of the CBT course, you will receive your CBT certificate (DL196) on the same day.
The certificate is valid for 2 years from the date of issue.

faqs.question: Do I still need to do the whole CBT if I've done it before?
answer: If your previous CBT certificate has expired (after 2 years), you will need to complete the full CBT course again.
There are no exemptions or shortened courses for expired CBT certificates.

faqs.question: Do I still need to do a CBT if I want to do the full motorcycle licence?
answer: If you already have a valid CBT certificate, you do not need to repeat the CBT to take your full motorcycle licence tests.
However, if your CBT has expired, you will need to complete a new CBT before taking your motorcycle theory and practical tests.

faqs.question: I've lost my CBT. Can I get a replacement CBT Certificate?
answer: Yes, you can obtain a replacement CBT certificate. Contact the training school where you completed your CBT.
There may be a small administrative fee for issuing a replacement certificate.
You will need to provide proof of identity and the approximate date you completed your CBT.
